intro: Pulassarium affine, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pulassarium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
